snippet: East African states agreed on Thursday to send troops to South Sudan by mid-April to help enforce a cease-fire deal between government forces and rebels, the chief mediator in peace talks said.
abstract: East African states of Ethiopia, Kenya, Burundi and Rwanda agree to send troops to South Sudan by mid-April to help enforce cease-fire deal between government forces and rebels.
lead_paragraph: East African states agreed on Thursday to send troops to South Sudan by mid-April to help enforce a cease-fire deal between government forces and rebels, the chief mediator in peace talks said.

headline.main: South Sudan: African States to Send Truce Monitors
headline.print_headline: South Sudan: African States to Send Truce Monitors
